text: Hello! Most of my career has seen me working in a visual programming language, namely LabVIEW. Because of this experience, when I move to my other favorite languages like F# or Racket, it feels like 2 steps forward and 3 steps backwards, primarily when it comes to being able to debugging and especially while the program is running. I am inspired by visual languages like vvvv, Pure Data, and TouchDesigner, and I am convinced that the future of programming is a hybrid approach, where there is tight integration but blurred lines between what is textually and visually specified. I am learning Pure Data and vvvv at the moment, and still have it on my plate to learn Touch Designer and Pharo, all the while I am working on designing my own language while also learning how to generally do so. :) The trouble is I'm not the smartest tool in the shed, so progress is slow but becoming tangible.

text: Hi all, I'm Thanh and I'm working on combining the power of as-code and no-code approaches to apply in data engineering and data analytics. I and my team are working on a new DSL and the toolset around it to realize this goal. Outside of this, I'm also quite interested in personal knowledge management and other ways to augment human cognitive abilities. Really looking forward to being part of this community!
